ref: 12296 śabára (often śavara -- ) m. ʻ a wild mountain tribe in the Deccan ʼ AitBr., ˚aka -- m. ʻ a savage ʼ Kāv.
Pk. savara -- m. ʻ an aboriginal tribe ʼ;
Pk. savara -- m. ʻ an aboriginal tribe ʼ;
Or. sahara, saara, saüra, f. saaruṇi ʻ a caste of aboriginal Gaṛajāts ʼ;
Si. savara ʻ a savage ʼ, habarayā ʻ archer, a Väddā ʼ ( -- b -- ?) EGS 188.
